Machine Learning is a Data Science Process.

A few years ago, Drew Conway came up with and shared his now-ubiquitous Data Science Venn Diagram:

Data Science Venn Diagram — Drew Conway

As we can see, Data Science is the intersection of 3 disciplines, and Hacking Skills is just one part of it. So, it is different from Software Development for production.

Data Science Development is more like a creative research process. the term Science reminds us that Experiments is an important part of this process. Therefore, AI Labs are needed for these workflows.

“An experiment is a procedure carried out to support, refute, or validate a hypothesis. Experiments vary greatly in goal and scale, but always rely on repeatable procedure and logical analysis of the results.” — Wikipedia

Experimentation is a key element of Machine Learning Development. Differently, from most Software Development disciplines, Machine Learning relies on Intuition - Validation rather than on empiric tests to assess the behavior of a specific model.

For those of you that never worked on building an end-to-end Machine Learning AI Lab, I’d like to shed a light on this process.
